render.tex: \title{Independent Events} Meaning \& mathematical test of independence

reason.tex:
%text \textbf{Independent Events} Two events $A$ and $B$ are independent if the happening of one \underline\text{does not } change the probability of the other happening also Mathematically, this is expressed as % \begin{align}
P \left(A\vert B \right) &= P(A) \\ P \left(B\vert A \right) &= P(B) \end{align} %text Now, for any two events $A$ and $B$ \small\[P \left(A\cap B \right) = P \left(A\vert B \right)\cdot P(B) = P \left(B\vert A \right)\cdot P(A)\]\normalsize \underline\text{But if $A$ and $B$ are independent}, then it is also true that \[ \qquad P \left(A\cap B \right) = P(A) \cdot P(B)\] %
